entries.femaleVariant: What happened? Did you find my brother?
He's safe and sound.
Not yet.
'Course I found him – he's safe and sound. Just needs to catch his breath.
Thank you. The universe will reward you for your good deeds.
Didn't get a chance yet. Everything takes time.
Time is precisely what he lacks! Please, I beg you, hurry!
Back so soon? Why are you alone? What about my brother?
He's dead.
I accidentally killed him.
Things got outta hand... I'm sorry, but he didn't make it.
entries.maleVariant: Things got outta hand... I'm sorry, he... he didn't make it.

entries.femaleVariant: Shots were fired. Lead was flying... One of my bullets accidentally hit him. I'm so sorry.
This is all my fault. I interfered in the karma of other souls. Had I not asked for your help... he would still be alive.
You, again. If you have finally come to help us, I am afraid it is too late.
They cut out his jaw and tongue. Without further modification he shall never speak again.
Once again, we offer you our humble thanks. You saved a great many lives... and limbs.
The pratimoksha vows are a guide to enlightenment, not binding laws. Though my path is paved with ever-greater challenges, I shall not give up.
Farewell. And do not stray from the path of righteousness.
Oh, you again. Thank you once again for your help...
And yet, you did not help. Good intentions do not justify murder. Please, leave us in peace.
I... I should not give in to base emotions, but I feel such a great relief that he is... unharmed.
Least I could do. What's the plan now? Can your brother still be a monk?
entries.maleVariant: Eh, least I could do. So, what's the plan now? Can your brother still be a monk?

entries.femaleVariant: Fine, be my guest.
Please, go. Just go...
What did they do to you?
Leave us. Let us endure our shame in peace.
And to think... I was the one who sent you there.
But... in his whole life he never hurt a living creature.
Thoughts on constructs?
Good luck.
Uh, humor me for a sec... if you don't look too kindly on having implants... then what do you think about constructs?
entries.maleVariant: Humor me for a sec... if you don't look too kindly on having implants, then... what do you think about constructs?

entries.femaleVariant: Well then, I wish you all the best of luck.
Ah, yes... You mean the Relic? A fashionable subject, is it not? It is a complex, fluctuating affair.
It all depends on whether the engram is a copy of a person or if this person merely exists in the digital realm.
Thanks.
Is a copy of a person still a person?
Let's say the engram's just a copy. What then? Could you say that person was... real?
entries.maleVariant: Let's say the engram was just a copy. What then? Could you say that person was... real?

entries.femaleVariant: Let's say an engram's just a person that's been digitized. Is that kosher, in your view?
If they are truly self-aware, a buddhist will recognize them as a human being.
A perfect copy of a complex human mind is still a human mind. But is it capable of reincarnation?
And if it's not, can it still be regarded as a being in possession of a soul?
What you're sayin', in other words, is "it's complicated."
Suffering is key. It has been there since the dawn of human existence. If a construct can suffer, it is a person.
Buddhism does not condemn digitization per se. Vending machines often preach in temples.
No, I would not condemn the simple act of transferral, under the condition that they are at peace with it.
One must still remember that they will still be imprisoned in their body... even if their body is not flesh.
Immortality isn't your thing, I'm guessin'?
He who cannot die cannot be born into a better life and will never achieve nirvana.
Digitization of people – that sit right with you?
What's your take, Johnny?
You don't say. Feel a headache comin' on just thinkin' about it...
What's your take, Johnny? You just you... or a copy?
entries.maleVariant: What's your take, Johnny? You just you, or... a copy?

entries.femaleVariant: What difference does it make? You heard 'im, I'm trapped in a few lines of code... and your body.
Maybe Johnny Silverhand really is dead? Maybe you're just an... well...
What, imitation? That what you wanted say?
If the "real" Johnny Silverhand's dead, then that's his problem. Not mine.
